fixes.name: Discount Amount
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted row-level multiplication [Sales]*[Discount] to a calculated column using 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales] * 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount].

fixes.name: Discount Health
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted row-level division [Discount Amount]/[Sales] to a calculated column using table-qualified column references.

fixes.name: Loss Flag
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted row-level conditional [Profit]<0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 to a calculated column using IF(condition, true, false).

fixes.name: Performance Code
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Is High Performing ] = "Yes", 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Quality Score ] + 2, 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Quality Score ] - 1)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted row-level conditional that adjusts [Quality Score ] based on [Is High Performing ] to a calculated column using IF and table-qualified references.

fixes.name: Discount Tier
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.25, "High Discount", IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.10, "Medium Discount", "Low Discont"))
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated nested IF/ELSEIF logic for discount tiers into nested IFs in DAX, using the row-level [Discount Health] column.

fixes.name: Final Score
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Tier] = "Low Discont", 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Performance Code] + 1, 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Performance Code])
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted row-level conditional adjusting [Performance Code] based on [Discount Tier] into a calculated column using IF.

fixes.name: Failure Risk
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Loss Flag] = 1 && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Tier] = "High Discount ", "High Risk", "Low Risk")
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the row-level conditional combining [Loss Flag] and [Discount Tier] into a DAX IF with && for AND; preserved literal strings exactly as in the Tableau expression.

fixes.name: Order Health Score
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Failure Risk] = "High Risk", 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Final Score] - 2, 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Final Score])
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the top-level row-level conditional that adjusts [Final Score] based on [Failure Risk] into a calculated column using IF and table-qualified references.
